guide.spawn_radar.about.core.title: What Spawn Radar does
guide.spawn_radar.about.core.body: Spawn Radar is a client-side toolkit for prospecting, cataloguing, and managing mob spawners. It automatically clusters nearby spawners, renders them on a configurable HUD, and exposes teleports, alerts, and highlight controls so you can turn raw discoveries into efficient farms.
guide.spawn_radar.about.core.tip1: • The block bank remembers every spawner it sees, even if you leave the area.
guide.spawn_radar.about.core.tip2: • Manual scans refine that raw list into clusters anchored around the player.
guide.spawn_radar.about.features.title: Why the HUD matters
guide.spawn_radar.about.features.body: Every HUD element is engineered for planning: from quick toggles to puppet previews and region overlays.
guide.spawn_radar.about.features.tip1: • Puppets/spawn eggs, spawn volumes, mob-cap boxes, previous/next page controls, and instant [Scan]/[Reset] buttons keep you in the flow.
guide.spawn_radar.about.features.tip2: • Alerts and highlights are shared across commands, so anything you do in chat is reflected on screen.
guide.spawn_radar.about.workflow.title: Typical workflow
guide.spawn_radar.about.workflow.body: Think of Spawn Radar as a layered pipeline:
guide.spawn_radar.about.workflow.step1: 1. Explore or load chunks and let background processing collect spawners.
guide.spawn_radar.about.workflow.step2: 2. Run a scan (cached or manual) to form clusters and review them in the HUD.
guide.spawn_radar.about.workflow.step3: 3. Teleport, toggle, and configure each cluster until it fits your farm plans.
guide.spawn_radar.about.outro: Rinse and repeat whenever you upgrade an area or branch into a new region.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.overview.body: Every command is client-side and instantaneous, which means you can bind them, macro them, or run them while the HUD is open.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.overview.tip1: • Results never depend on server tick speed.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.overview.tip2: • They all share the same cached data set.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.title: Command reference
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_s: /radar:scan [manual] [sorting] [radius] — Fresh scan around you. Add "manual" to ignore cached data, choose proximity|size sorting, and override the radius (1-256).
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_t: /radar:toggle <id|all> — Flip a single cluster highlight or all clusters.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_i: /radar:info <id> — Lists every spawner in the cluster with teleport and copy-to-clipboard helpers.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_r: /radar:reset — Clears the block bank, clusters, highlights, and HUD state (perfect before sharing screenshots).
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_g: /radar:guide — Opens this manual again from anywhere.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.details.cmd_h: /radar:help [command] — Recaps arguments, shortcuts, and usage tips.
guide.spawn_radar.commands.tip: Tip: Bind the scan/reset keybinds in the controls menu to trigger these workflows without leaving the HUD.
guide.spawn_radar.config.options.title: Scanning & alert options
guide.spawn_radar.config.options.body: Open the config screen (Mod Menu ▸ Spawn Radar) to tune thread counts, default radii, cached-scan behaviour, and background alert thresholds.
guide.spawn_radar.config.options.tip1: • Raise worker threads when scanning huge worlds; lower them if your machine already runs heavy shaders.
guide.spawn_radar.config.options.tip2: • Alert proximity + threshold sliders decide whether 2-spawner dungeons or mega-project clusters should ping you.
guide.spawn_radar.config.presets.title: HUD & rendering presets
guide.spawn_radar.config.presets.body: Mix icon styles, outline colours, opacity, panel positions, and page sizes for different jobs.
guide.spawn_radar.config.presets.tip1: • Keep a low-opacity "survey" preset for exploration and a bold "base" preset for detailed planning.
guide.spawn_radar.config.presets.tip2: • Volume toggles and region fills can be bound per cluster, so experiment with colours that stand out from your builds.
guide.spawn_radar.config.advanced.title: Advanced tricks
guide.spawn_radar.config.advanced.body: Because all data is client-side, you can share config folders with teammates to keep colours and panel layouts consistent.
guide.spawn_radar.config.advanced.tip1: • Export your config before big base tours so everyone sees identical highlights.
guide.spawn_radar.config.advanced.tip2: • Cached scans + manual rescans are complementary: cached for quick refreshes, manual for world edits or post-schematic cleanup.
